txt.en: In the fourth hour of your watch... is that movement?
'I will not return to my father in disgrace!'
'Better to die here than return in failure!'
'So it would seem.'
'When you were imprisoned in the caves, my father showed you mercy.'
For the first hour of your watch all is well.
'I will not make the same mistake! Kill them, my warriors!'
In the second hour of your watch you fight boredom.
'To me, my warriors!'
In the third hour of your watch you worry about the Shire.
'Kill them, kill them, kill them!'
In the fourth hour of your watch... did you see something?

'There is no honour to be had by attacking a sleeping foe, Halros, but we should have expected nothing else from the Falcon Clan. Mair learned that tonight, to her sorrow.

'We have not repaid Lheu Brenin and the Falcon Clan for our losses, not by a wide throw, but we have shown them our claws. We are all fortunate you have such alert senses, Halros!

'I am glad you journeyed south with us, for this reason and many others. Look! Dawn breaks. Your vigil for the night is ended! Let us break our fast and see to the coming of the day.'

'I am sorry to wake you, Halros, but it is time for your watch to begin. These last few hours have been quiet, and it was a struggle at times to keep my eyes open. I will be glad of the sleep.\n\n'There is a good place to watch among the trees just to the west. I will show you.'

'I thought this would happen one of these nights. We may not have much time before the Falcon Clan strikes!

'You three slip down the hill to the side and see if you can approach our attackers from behind.

'Halros! Prestadír! Come with me, and we will see if they can listen to reason.'
'This way.'
'Right here, Halros, among these trees.'
That was a Falcon Clan scout! The camp is about to be attacked!
'Good luck, Halros. I will see you in the morning.'
Halbarad has been defeated!
Prestadír has woken you for your turn at the watch. You have five hours to spend until the dawn.
For the first hour of your watch nothing moves.
In the second hour of your watch you fight boredom.
In the third hour of your watch you worry about the Shire you left behind.
In the fourth hour of your watch... did something move?
Follow Prestadír to the good watching-spot
Talk to Prestadír
Stand watch until dawn
For the first hour of your watch nothing stirs.
Investigate your uneasy feeling
In the second hour of your watch your mind wanders.
Wake up your brethren before the Falcon Clan attacks!
In the third hour of your watch you hope the Shire is protected without you.
Talk to Halbarad and prepare for the Falcon Clan attack
In the fourth hour of your watch... did that shadow move?
Fight alongside Halbarad and Prestadír
Talk to Halbarad
'Halros? What have you seen? Are we in danger?'
For the first hour of your watch all is quiet.
In the second hour of your watch your thoughts meander.
In the third hour of your watch you hope the Shire is safe.
'Good eye, Halros. We can prepare before our foes are upon us!'
In the fourth hour of your watch... what is that? Movement?
'Show yourselves, Falcons! Even a sleeping Dúnadan cannot be surprised by the like of you.'
Prestadír has woken you for your turn at watch.
'It is over. Farewell, Mair.'
It is now your turn to keep watch while the rest of the Grey Company sleeps. You will waken Halbarad at the dawn.
'Your father will join you soon.'
Did you see something move in the darkness?
'You three find out the number of our foes.'
You need to wake up your comrades before the attack!
Halbarad has instructions for you, and you should receive them quickly! The Falcon Clan attack is imminent!
Halbarad is waiting to speak with you following the attack by the Falcon Clan.
'Halros, what... what is it?'
'What is going on?'
'What?'
'Danger?'
'Are we under attack?'
'What is going on?'
'Halros? What has happened?'
'What happened?'
'I am ready!'
Interlude: Halros's Watch
For the first hour of your watch you see nothing unusual.
In the second hour of your watch your mind wanders.
In the third hour of your watch you think of the Shire you left behind.
